desc: output the last K bytes; with +K output bytes starting with the Kth
output appended data as the file grows
output the last K lines; with +K output lines starting with the Kth
with --follow=name, reopen a FILE which has not changed size after N iterations
with -f, terminate after process ID, PID dies
never output headers giving file names
keep trying to open a file even when it is inaccessible; useful with --follow=name
with -f, sleep for approximately N seconds (default 1.0) between iterations
always output headers giving file names
output the last K bytes or only K bytes with -r
output the last K lines, instead of the last 10 - or only K lines with -r
